documents.metaDescription: This quality standard covers how to help people return to work after long-term sickness absence, reduce recurring sickness absence, and help prevent people moving from short-term to long-term sickness absence. It covers everyone aged over 16 in full-time or part-time employment (paid or unpaid). It describes high-quality care in priority areas for improvement.
documents.subSectionLinks:
<SubSections>
  <link url="/guidance/qs202">Overview</link>
  <link url="/guidance/qs202/chapter/Quality-statements">Quality statements</link>
  <link url="/guidance/qs202/chapter/Quality-statement-1-Workplace-culture-and-policies">Quality statement 1: Workplace culture and policies</link>
  <link url="/guidance/qs202/chapter/Quality-statement-2-Support-during-sickness-absence">Quality statement 2: Support during sickness absence</link>
  <link url="/guidance/qs202/chapter/Quality-statement-3-Statement-of-fitness-for-work-fit-note">Quality statement 3: Statement of fitness for work ('fit note')</link>
  <link url="/guidance/qs202/chapter/Quality-statement-4-Support-to-stay-in-or-return-to-work">Quality statement 4: Support to stay in or return to work</link>
  <link url="/guidance/qs202/chapter/About-this-quality-standard">About this quality standard</link>
</SubSections>
documents.teaser: This quality standard covers how to help people return to work after long-term sickness absence, reduce recurring sickness absence, and help prevent people moving from short-term to long-term sickness absence. It covers everyone aged over 16 in full-time or part-time employment (paid or unpaid). It describes high-quality care in priority areas for improvement.
documents.title: Workplace health: long-term sickness absence and capability to work (QS202)
titleParts: ce health: long-term sickness absence and capability to work  (QS202)

documents.metaDescription: This quality standard covers care for adults (aged 18 and over) who are approaching the end of their life. This includes people who are likely to die within 12 months, people with advanced, progressive, incurable conditions and people with life-threatening acute conditions. It also covers support for their families and carers. It includes care provided by health and social care staff in all settings. It describes high-quality care in priority areas for improvement.
documents.subSectionLinks:

  <link url="/guidance/qs13/chapter/Quality-statement-2-Advance-care-planning">Quality statement 2: Advance care planning</link>
  <link url="/guidance/qs13/chapter/Quality-statement-3-Coordinated-care">Quality statement 3: Coordinated care</link>
  <link url="/guidance/qs13/chapter/Quality-statement-4-Out-of-hours-care">Quality statement 4: Out-of-hours care</link>
  <link url="/guidance/qs13/chapter/Quality-statement-5-Support-for-carers">Quality statement 5: Support for carers</link>
  <link url="/guidance/qs13/chapter/Update-information">Update information</link>
</SubSections>
documents.teaser: This quality standard covers care for adults (aged 18 and over) who are approaching the end of their life. This includes people who are likely to die within 12 months, people with advanced, progressive, incurable conditions and people with life-threatening acute conditions. It also covers support for their families and carers. It includes care provided by health and social care staff in all settings. It describes high-quality care in priority areas for improvement.
